title: In Honduras Presidential Election, Leftist Candidate Holds a Big Lead
sub_head: Central American nation holds tense contest between a mayor accused of corruption, who is behind, and potentially its first female leader
body:
The wife of a controversial former leftist president deposed by the military 12 years ago, appeared headed for a comfortable victory in presidential elections in Honduras.
With just over half the ballots counted early Monday, Xiomara Castro de Zelaya had 54% of the vote, a 20-percentage point lead over her main rival Nasry Asfura, the ruling National Party candidate, who had 34%.
